Amendments to the Ordinance for Enforcement of the Equal Employment Opportunity Act come into force on July 1 and will prohibit employers from unreasonably requiring job applicants or employees to accept potential internal transfers involving relocation as a condition for employment ( These conditions were occasionally used to discriminate against or harass female workers who are considered to have less flexibility in relocating than male workers ) .
